title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team richel@richelbilderbeek.nl. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code--conduct.html answers common questions code conduct, see https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq

title: Contributing
text: Awesome reading . GitHub follows Contributor Covenant Code Conduct. questions, can create Issue Code changes go via Pull Requests

title: Contributing
text: beautier part babette package suite, consists five packages. determine package best suited contribution: want contribute BEAST2 run, go beautier. want contribute BEAST2 output parsed, go tracerer want contribute regarding BEAST2 package management, go mauricer want contribute overarching idea, go babette. want contribute creation BEAST2 XML input files, right spot :-)

title: Contributing
text: Use cases within default BEAUti environment welcomed. Please send needed reproduce use case: alignment file screenshots BEAUti settings ’ve changed resulting XML file (optional) desired call beautier BEAUti plugins supported (now). See ‘Submitting code’ ’d like beautier . can : Add Issue Send @richelbilderbeek email (@richelbilderbeek make Issue )

title: Contributing
text: Submitted code follow quality guidelines: tests pass cleanly/silently Code coverage 95% Coding style follow default style lintr checked Travis CI submitting Pull Request. BEAUti plugins, needs added: Enough documentation example use case can reproduced Stating maintenance done Collaborator Emails code accepted.

title: Contributing
text: Awesome. options: Add Issue, test fails Submit Pull Request, test added tests/testthat folder Send @richelbilderbeek email (@richelbilderbeek make Issue ) Pull Requests follow guidelines ‘Submitting code’.

title: Contributing
text: master branch always build successfully development branch developers

title: Contributing
text: get started working beautier : Development done develop branch. download checkout develop branch, first go beautier folder (cd beautier), : workflow common git workflow:
code: git clone https://github.com/ropensci/beautier git checkout develop git pull git add --all :/ git commit -m "Did something awesome" git push

title: beautier demo
text: purpose beautier create valid BEAST2 XML input file function argument. way, scientific pipeline using BEAST2 can fully scripted, instead using BEAUti’s GUI. beautier part babette package suite (website https://github.com/ropensci/babette). babette allows use BEAST2 (tools) R.

title: beautier demo
text: First, beautier loaded: BEAST2 XML input file needs alignment (BEAST2 infers phylogenies parameters DNA sequences). demonstration uses testing FASTA file used beautier: can display alignment file:  Specify filename XML file, use temporary filename, need clean afterwards: Now can create XML file. specify inference model, just use BEAUti default settings:  file indeed BEAST2 input file: XML input file can read BEAST2. can use beastier run BEAST2 R, see https://github.com/ropensci/beastier. can use babette BEAST2 inference directly, see https://github.com/ropensci/babette.

title: beautier demo
Examples
text: purpose beautier create valid BEAST2 XML input file function argument. way, scientific pipeline using BEAST2 can fully scripted, instead using BEAUti’s GUI. beautier part babette package suite (website https://github.com/ropensci/babette). babette allows use BEAST2 (tools) R.

title: Examples
text: examples, load beautier: example shows picture BEAUti dialog achieve . BEAUti part BEAST2 tool suite ’s GUI create BEAST2 input files. beautier R package supplement BEAUti, providing R script. example reads alignment FASTA file called anthus_aco_sub.fas, part files supplied beautier: vignette, generated BEAST2 XML shown. Use create_beast2_input_file save resulting XML directly file instead.

title: Examples
text: Using default settings, specify DNA alignment. parameters set defaults, BEAUti.

title: Examples

title: Examples
Inference Models
text: beautier allows specify inference model, , together DNA alignment, posterior (holding distribution phylogenies jointly-estimated parameter estimates) can inferred. inference model entails evolutionary model used inference, well settings inference. vignette shows options specify inference model, options possible.

title: Inference Models
text: First, load beautier: Now, ’ll look default inference model get idea inference model entails.

title: Inference Models
text: Creating default inference model easy: inference model list, uses BEAST2 defaults. elements list: can see, inference model entails elements, cover detail: site model: alignment changes clock model: mutation rates differ branches tree prior: speciation model (optional) MRCA prior: ‘Recent Common Ancestor’ MCMC: Markov Chain Monte Carlo setup (optional) BEAUti options: version-specific options (experimental) tipdates filename: filename tip-dating

title: Inference Models
text: site model entails alignment changes time. Currently, beautier supplies gamma site model. One element site model, DNA/RNA, nucleotide substitution model (‘NSM’). Due historical reasons, beautier confuses site model NSM: beautier functions word ‘nucleotide substitution’ (nsm) `. Instead, specific site models. see available site models, use ?create_site_model see list, use: simplest NSM JC69 NSM, assumes nucleotides substituted one another rate. example, use gamma site model JC69 NSM model inference:

title: Inference Models
text: clock model entails mutation rates differ branches. see available site models, use ?create_clock_model see list, use: simplest clock model strict clock model, assumes branches mutation rate. example, use strict clock model inference:

title: Inference Models
text: tree prior tree model used inference. called ‘tree prior’ instead ‘tree model’, follow BEAUti naming. tree model specifies branching process tree. see available tree models, use ?create_tree_prior see list, use: simplest tree model Yule (aka pure-birth) tree model, assumes branching events occur constant rate, extinctions. example, use Yule tree model inference:

what: (optional) MRCA prior: a ‘Most Recent Common Ancestor’
title: Inference Models
text: MRCA (‘Recent Common Ancestor’) prior, one can specify tips share common ancestor.
code: # The alignmet fasta_filename <- get_beautier_path("anthus_aco.fas")  # The alignment's ID alignment_id <- get_alignment_id(fasta_filename)  # Get the first two taxa's names taxa_names <- get_taxa_names(fasta_filename)[1:2]  # Specify that the first two taxa share a common ancestor mrca_prior <- create_mrca_prior(   alignment_id = alignment_id,   taxa_names = taxa_names )  # Use the MRCA prior in inference inference_model <- create_inference_model(   mrca_prior = mrca_prior )

what: MCMC: the Markov Chain Monte Carlo setup
title: Inference Models
text: MCMC (‘Markov Chain Monte Carlo’) specifies inference algorithm work. available MCMC’s can found using ?create_mcmc : create_mcmc: regular MCMC create_test_mcmc: shorter regular MCMC, used testing create_ns_mcmc: MCMC estimate marginal likelihood using nested sampling

title: Inference Models
text: BEAUti options entail version-specific options store inference model BEAST2 XML input file. available BEAUti options can found using ?create_beauti_options : create_beauti_options_v2_4: BEAUti v2.4 create_beauti_options_v2_6: BEAUti v2.6 Using specific version inference:

what: (experimental) a tipdates filename: a filename for tip-dating
title: Inference Models
text: tipdates filename experimental feature tip-dating: tipdates filename alignment must compatible. example:
code: inference_model <- create_inference_model(   tipdates_filename = get_beautier_path("G_VII_pre2003_dates_4.txt") ) output_filename <- get_beautier_tempfilename()  create_beast2_input_file_from_model(   input_filename = get_beautier_path("G_VII_pre2003_msa.fas"),   inference_model = inference_model,   output_filename = output_filename ) # Cleanup file.remove(output_filename) #> [1] TRUE  beautier::remove_beautier_folder() beautier::check_empty_beautier_folder()

code: if (is_on_ci()) {    check_empty_beautier_folder()    # Get an example FASTA file   input_filename <- get_fasta_filename()    # The file created by beautier, a BEAST2 input file   output_filename <- get_beautier_tempfilename()    # Use the default BEAUti settings to create a BEAST2 input file   create_beast2_input_file_from_model(     input_filename,     output_filename,     inference_model = create_inference_model()   )    # Remove the folder that contains the beautier temporary files   remove_beautier_folder()   check_empty_beautier_folder() }

title: Create a Most Recent Common Ancestor prior — create_mrca_prior
text: alignment_id ID alignment, returned get_alignment_id. Keep NA initialized automatically taxa_names names taxa, returned get_taxa_names. Keep NA initialized automatically, using taxa alignment is_monophyletic boolean indicate monophyly assumed Recent Common Ancestor prior, returned create_mrca_prior mrca_distr distribution used MRCA prior. Can NA (default) distribution returned create_distr name unique name MRCA prior, example genus, family, order even class name. Leave NA named automatically. clock_prior_distr_id ID MRCA clock model's distribution. Keep NA initialized automatically

code: check_empty_beautier_folder()  fasta_filename <- get_beautier_path("anthus_aco.fas")   # The first two taxa are sister species  mrca_prior <- create_mrca_prior(    taxa_names = get_taxa_names(filename = fasta_filename)[1:2]  )   # The taxa are monophyletic  mrca_prior <- create_mrca_prior(    taxa_names = get_taxa_names(filename = fasta_filename),    is_monophyletic = TRUE  )   # Set the crown age to 10  mrca_prior <- create_mrca_prior(    taxa_names = get_taxa_names(fasta_filename),    mrca_distr = create_normal_distr(mean = 10, sigma = 0.1)  )  check_empty_beautier_folder()

title: Create a relaxed log-normal clock model — create_rln_clock_model
text: id alignment's IDs. ID can extracted FASTA filename get_alignment_ids_from_fasta_filenames) mean_rate_prior_distr mean clock rate prior distribution, created create_distr function ucldstdev_distr standard deviation uncorrelated log-normal distribution, created create_distr function mparam_id ID M parameter branchRateModel, set NA initialized mean_clock_rate mean clock rate, 1.0 default (called ucld_stdev XML, ucld_stdev always 0.1) n_rate_categories number rate categories. -1 default, 0 denotes much rates branches normalize_mean_clock_rate normalize mean clock rate dimension dimensionality relaxed clock model. Leave NA let beautier calculate . Else, dimensionality clock equals twice number taxa minus two. rate_scaler_factor strict clock model's operator scaler rate. Use empty string indicate default.

code: if (is_on_ci()) {    check_empty_beautier_folder()    beast2_input_file <- get_beautier_tempfilename()    bd_tree_prior <- create_bd_tree_prior()   cbs_tree_prior <- create_cbs_tree_prior()   ccp_tree_prior <- create_ccp_tree_prior()   cep_tree_prior <- create_cep_tree_prior()   yule_tree_prior <- create_yule_tree_prior()    # Use any of the above tree priors   create_beast2_input_file(     input_filename = get_fasta_filename(),     beast2_input_file,     tree_prior = bd_tree_prior   )   file.remove(beast2_input_file)    remove_beautier_folder()   check_empty_beautier_folder() }

Keep NA initialized automatically allow_empty_str allow string empty allow_na allow NA alpha_parameter alpha parameter, created create_alpha_param b_pop_sizes_param Bayesian population size parameter, created create_b_pop_sizes_param b_pop_sizes_parameter Bayesian population size parameter, created create_b_pop_sizes_param bd_tree_prior Birth-Death tree prior, created create_bd_tree_prior beautier_folder path beautier temporary files folder cbs_tree_prior Coalescent Bayesian Skyline tree prior, returned create_cbs_tree_prior beast2_version BEAST2 version, example, "2.5" beauti_options one BEAUti options object, returned create_beauti_options beta_parameter beta parameter, created create_beta_param ccp_tree_prior Coalescent Constant Population tree prior, returned create_ccp_tree_prior cep_tree_prior Coalescent Exponential Population tree prior, returned create_cep_tree_prior chain_length length MCMC chain clock_model clock model, returned create_clock_model clock_model_name name clock model, must name returned get_clock_model_names clock_model_names one names clock model, must name among returned get_clock_model_names clock_models list one clock models, returned create_clock_model clock_prior_distr_id ID MRCA clock model's distribution. Keep NA initialized automatically clock_rate_param clockRate parameter, numeric value, created create_clock_rate_param crown_age crown age phylogeny crown_ages crown ages phylogenies. Set NA crown age needs estimated distr_id distributions' ID fasta_filename FASTA filename. Use get_fasta_filename obtain testing FASTA filename. Note BEAST2 also supports missing data, using dash (-) question mark (?) sequence. fasta_filenames One FASTA filenames. Use get_fasta_filename obtain testing FASTA filename. filename filename, can checked check_filename fixed_crown_age determines phylogeny's crown age fixed. FALSE, crown age estimated BEAST2. TRUE, crown age fixed crown age initial phylogeny. fixed_crown_ages one booleans determine phylogenies' crown ages fixed. FALSE, crown age estimated BEAST2. TRUE, crown age fixed crown age initial phylogeny. freq_param `freq` parameter, created create_freq_param gamma_distr gamma distribution, created create_gamma_distr) gamma_site_model site model's gamma site model, returned create_gamma_site_model group_sizes_dimension group sizes' dimension, used CBS tree prior (see create_cbs_tree_prior) gtr_site_model GTR site model, returned create_gtr_site_model has_non_strict_clock_model boolean indicate already least one non-strict (.e. relaxed log-normal) clock model has_tip_dating TRUE user supplied tip dates, FALSE otherwise hky_site_model HKY site model, returned create_hky_site_model id alignment's IDs. ID can extracted FASTA filename get_alignment_ids_from_fasta_filenames) ids one alignments' IDs. IDs can extracted FASTA filenames get_alignment_ids_from_fasta_filenames) inference_model Bayesian phylogenetic inference model. inference model complete model setup site model, clock model, tree prior specified. Use create_inference_model create inference model. Use check_inference_model check  inference model valid. Use rename_inference_model_filenames rename files inference model. inference_models list one inference models, can created create_inference_model initial_phylogenies one MCMC chain's initial phylogenies. one set NA result BEAST2 using random phylogeny. Else phylogeny assumed class phylo ape package input_filename FASTA filename. Use get_fasta_filename obtain testing FASTA filename. input_filenames One FASTA filenames. Use get_fasta_filename obtain testing FASTA filename. is_monophyletic boolean indicate monophyly assumed Recent Common Ancestor prior, returned create_mrca_prior jc69_site_model JC69 site model, returned create_jc69_site_model kappa_param kappa parameter, created create_kappa_param log_every number MCMC states writing file m_param m parameter, created create_m_param mcmc one MCMC. Use create_mcmc create MCMC. Use create_ns_mcmc create MCMC   Nested Sampling run. Use check_mcmc check MCMC valid. Use rename_mcmc_filenames rename filenames MCMC. mode mode log. Valid values ones returned get_log_modes mrca_prior Recent Common Ancestor prior, returned create_mrca_prior mrca_priors list one Recent Common Ancestor priors, returned create_mrca_prior mrca_prior_name unique name MRCA prior, example genus, family, order even class name. Leave NA named automatically. n_init_attempts number initialization attempts failing output_filename Name XML parameter file created function. BEAST2 uses file input. param parameter, can created create_param. param_id parameter's ID phylogeny phylogeny type phylo ape package pop_sizes_scaler_scale_factor scale factor used population sizes scaler operator pre_burnin number burn samples taken entering main loop rate_scaler_factor strict clock model's operator scaler rate. Use empty string indicate default. rename_fun function rename filename, can checked check_rename_fun. function one argument, filename NA. function return one filename (passed one filename) one NA (passed one NA). Example rename functions : get_remove_dir_fun get function removes directory     paths filenames, effect turning local files get_replace_dir_fun get function replaces directory     paths filenames get_remove_hex_fun get function removes     hex string filenames.     example, tracelog_82c1a522040.log becomes tracelog.log rln_clock_model Relaxed Log-Normal clock model, returned create_rln_clock_model sample_from_prior set TRUE sample prior sanitise_headers set TRUE sanitise headers log file screenlog screenlog, created create_screenlog sequence_length DNA sequence length, base pairs site_model site model, returned create_site_model site_model_name name site model, must name returned get_site_model_names site_model_names one names site model, must name among returned get_site_model_names site_models one site models, returned create_site_model sort sort log. Valid values ones returned get_log_sorts store_every number states MCMC process posterior's state saved file. Use -1 NA use default frequency. strict_clock_model strict clock model, returned create_strict_clock_model taxa_names names taxa, returned get_taxa_names. Keep NA initialized automatically, using taxa alignment tipdates_filename name file containing tip dates. file assumed two columns, separated tab. first column contains taxa names, second column contains date. tn93_site_model TN93 site model, returned create_tn93_site_model tracelog tracelog, created create_tracelog treelog treelog, created create_treelog tree_prior tree priors, returned create_tree_prior tree_prior_name name tree prior, must name returned get_tree_prior_names tree_prior_names one names tree prior, must name among returned get_tree_prior_names tree_priors one tree priors, returned create_tree_prior verbose TRUE, additional information displayed, potentially useful debugging yule_tree_prior Yule tree_prior, created create_yule_tree_prior

code: check_empty_beautier_folder()   # <distribution id="posterior" spec="util.CompoundDistribution">  #     <distribution id="prior" spec="util.CompoundDistribution">  #       HERE, where the ID of the distribution is 'prior'  #     </distribution>  #     <distribution id="likelihood" ...>  #     </distribution>  # </distribution>  # Must be an initialized inference model inference_model <- create_inference_model(   clock_model = create_rln_clock_model(     id = "test_output_0",     ucldstdev_distr = create_gamma_distr(       id = 0,       alpha = create_alpha_param(id = 2, value = "0.5396"),       beta = create_beta_param(id = 3, value = "0.3819")     ),     mean_rate_prior_distr = create_uniform_distr(id = 1),     mparam_id = 1   ) )  rln_clock_model_to_xml_prior_distr(inference_model) #> [1] "<prior id=\"ucldStdevPrior.c:test_output_0\" name=\"distribution\" x=\"@ucldStdev.c:test_output_0\">" #> [2] "    <Gamma id=\"Gamma.0\" name=\"distr\">"                                                            #> [3] "        <parameter id=\"RealParameter.2\" estimate=\"false\" name=\"alpha\">0.5396</parameter>"       #> [4] "        <parameter id=\"RealParameter.3\" estimate=\"false\" name=\"beta\">0.3819</parameter>"        #> [5] "    </Gamma>"                                                                                         #> [6] "</prior>"                                                                                              check_empty_beautier_folder()
